tianchen92 commented on pull request #6684: ARROW-8158: [Java] Getting length of data buffer and base variable width vector
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6684
 
 
   For string data buffer and base variable width vector can we have a way to get length of the data? 
   
   For instance, in ArrowColumnVector in StringAccessor we use stringResult.start and stringResult.end, instead we would like to get length of the data through an exposed function.
   
   Now we have getStartOffset in BaseVariableVector and getElementStartIndex/getElementEndIndex in BaseListVector. To be consistent, we add getEndOffset for BaseVariableVector.

kou opened a new pull request #7280:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7280


   LLVM 7 and 8 are still supported.
   
   Debian GNU/Linux stretch based
   images (ci/docker/linux-apt-jni.dockerfile and
   dev/tasks/linux-packages/apache-arrow/apt/debian-stretch/Dockerfile)
   still use LLVM 8 because LLVM 9 packages for strech at apt.llvm.org
   are broken. (LLVM 10 packages aren't broken.)
   
   CentOS 8 packages still use LLVM 8 because there are no packages for
   LLVM 9 on CentOS 8.
   
   manylinux1 still use LLVM 8 because g++ 4.8.2 is old to build LLVM 9
   or later.

kou commented on pull request #7280:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7280#issuecomment-635597352


   > According to [this discussion](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7295#issuecomment-635351048), could you please update the LLVM part of LICENSE.txt?
   
   Thanks for notifying this. I've updated.
   
   The new `LICENSE.txt` mentions bundled software:
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7280/commits/4a8464512c9b60a7f1aea6e699184438f51969c0#diff-61e0bdf7e1b43c5c93d9488b22e04170R1298-R1308
   
   ```text
   ==============================================================================
   Software from third parties included in the LLVM Project:
   ==============================================================================
   The LLVM Project contains third party software which is under different license
   terms. All such code will be identified clearly using at least one of two
   mechanisms:
   1) It will be in a separate directory tree with its own `LICENSE.txt` or
      `LICENSE` file at the top containing the specific license and restrictions
      which apply to that software, or
   2) It will contain specific license and restriction terms at the top of every
      file.
   ```
   
   I've checked bundled software in LLVM 9. There are 2 software:
   
   * llvm/test/YAMLParser/LICENSE.txt
   * llvm/utils/unittest/googlemock/LICENSE.txt
   
   Both of them are for testing. So I didn't put additional license information to our `LICENSE.txt`.

fields.description:
For string data buffer and base variable width vector can we have a way to get length of the data? 

For instance, in ArrowColumnVector in StringAccessor we use stringResult.start and stringResult.end, instead we would like to get length of the data through an exposed function.
fields.summary: [Java] Getting length of data buffer and base variable width vector

comments.body:
Hi, I think one could get valid data length by BaseVariableWidthVector#sizeOfValueBuffer.

[https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/BaseVariableWidthVector.java#L582]

[~tianchen92] The issue is there isn't a clear way to get the length of an individual VarChar or Bytes element (one needs to go through the holder or access the offsets buffer directly).  A similar issue exists for lists.

[~emkornfield] I see, I could add a method like {{getDataLength(int index)}} for variable width vector.

For lists, we already have {{getElementStartIndex/getElementEndIndex}}, is it enough or still need to add a method like getElementLength?
we should probably be consistent and have getEndIndex or something like that instead of length.
